imgs.text: New York Yacht Club 30 photo on sailboatdata.com
New York Yacht Club 30 drawing on sailboatdata.com

name: NEW YORK YACHT CLUB 30
notes: With a waterline length of 30'', this was the smallest of the Universal Rule-influenced one-design classes built for New York Yacht Club members. As a class it was active into the early 1930's. In recent years, a few of the existing boats have been restored to a very high standard.
